input: Create ecommerce schema for tables users, customers, addresses, orders, order_items, payments
output:
Table users {
  id char(26) [pk]
  email varchar(150)
  password_hash varchar(255)
  status varchar(50)
  role varchar(50)
  email_verified boolean
  last_login_at datetime
  created_at datetime
  updated_at datetime
}

Table customers {
  id char(26) [pk]
  user_id char(26) [ref: > users.id]
  first_name varchar(150)
  last_name varchar(150)
  phone varchar(30)
  date_of_birth date
  loyalty_points int
  created_at datetime
  updated_at datetime
}

Table addresses {
  id char(26) [pk]
  customer_id char(26) [ref: > customers.id]
  street varchar(255)
  city varchar(150)
  state varchar(150)
  country varchar(150)
  postal_code varchar(20)
  address_type varchar(50)
  is_default boolean
  created_at datetime
  updated_at datetime
}

Table orders {
  id char(26) [pk]
  customer_id char(26) [ref: > customers.id]
  address_id char(26) [ref: > addresses.id]
  subtotal decimal(10,2)
  tax_amount decimal(10,2)
  shipping_amount decimal(10,2)
  discount_amount decimal(10,2)
  total_amount decimal(10,2)
  currency varchar(10)
  status varchar(50)
  created_at datetime
  updated_at datetime
}

Table order_items {
  id char(26) [pk]
  order_id char(26) [ref: > orders.id]
  product_name varchar(255)
  sku varchar(150)
  quantity int
  unit_price decimal(10,2)
  discount_amount decimal(10,2)
  total_price decimal(10,2)
  created_at datetime
}

Table payments {
  id char(26) [pk]
  order_id char(26) [ref: > orders.id]
  amount decimal(10,2)
  currency varchar(10)
  method varchar(100)
  transaction_id varchar(255)
  payment_status varchar(50)
  gateway_response text
  paid_at datetime
  created_at datetime
}

input: Create ecommerce schema for tables products, categories, brands, product_images, inventories, suppliers
output:
Table brands {
  id char(26) [pk]
  name varchar(150)
  description text
  logo_url varchar(500)
  website_url varchar(255)
  status varchar(50)
  created_at datetime
  updated_at datetime
}

Table categories {
  id char(26) [pk]
  name varchar(150)
  slug varchar(150)
  parent_id char(26) [ref: > categories.id]
  status varchar(50)
  created_at datetime
  updated_at datetime
}

Table products {
  id char(26) [pk]
  brand_id char(26) [ref: > brands.id]
  name varchar(255)
  description text
  sku varchar(150)
  barcode varchar(150)
  price decimal(10,2)
  cost_price decimal(10,2)
  weight decimal(10,2)
  status varchar(50)
  created_at datetime
  updated_at datetime
}

Table product_images {
  id char(26) [pk]
  product_id char(26) [ref: > products.id]
  image_url varchar(500)
  alt_text varchar(255)
  sort_order int
  is_primary boolean
  created_at datetime
}

Table inventories {
  id char(26) [pk]
  product_id char(26) [ref: > products.id]
  quantity int
  reserved_quantity int
  available_quantity int
  reorder_level int
  warehouse_location varchar(255)
  updated_at datetime
}

Table suppliers {
  id char(26) [pk]
  name varchar(150)
  contact_email varchar(150)
  phone varchar(30)
  address varchar(255)
  rating decimal(3,2)
  status varchar(50)
  created_at datetime
  updated_at datetime
}

input: Create ecommerce schema for tables carts, cart_items, coupons, coupon_redemptions, wishlists, wishlist_items
output:
Table carts {
  id char(26) [pk]
  customer_id char(26)
  status varchar(50)
  total_items int
  total_amount decimal(10,2)
  currency varchar(10)
  created_at datetime
  updated_at datetime
}

Table cart_items {
  id char(26) [pk]
  cart_id char(26) [ref: > carts.id]
  product_id char(26)
  quantity int
  unit_price decimal(10,2)
  line_total decimal(10,2)
  created_at datetime
}

Table coupons {
  id char(26) [pk]
  code varchar(100)
  discount_type varchar(50)
  discount_value decimal(10,2)
  usage_limit int
  used_count int
  is_active boolean
  expires_at datetime
  created_at datetime
}

Table coupon_redemptions {
  id char(26) [pk]
  coupon_id char(26) [ref: > coupons.id]
  customer_id char(26)
  order_id char(26)
  discount_amount decimal(10,2)
  redeemed_at datetime
}

Table wishlists {
  id char(26) [pk]
  customer_id char(26)
  name varchar(150)
  visibility varchar(50)
  created_at datetime
  updated_at datetime
}

Table wishlist_items {
  id char(26) [pk]
  wishlist_id char(26) [ref: > wishlists.id]
  product_id char(26)
  added_at datetime
  priority int
}

input: Create ecommerce schema for tables reviews, ratings, returns, refunds, invoices, taxes, tax_rates
output:
Table reviews {

  is_verified_purchase boolean

  updated_at datetime
}

Table ratings {
  id char(26) [pk]

  score int

}

Table returns {
  id char(26) [pk]

  approved_at datetime
  created_at datetime
  updated_at datetime
}

Table refunds {
  id char(26) [pk]
  return_id char(26) [ref: > returns.id]
  refund_number varchar(150)

  status varchar(50)
  refunded_at datetime
  created_at datetime
}

Table invoices {
  id char(26) [pk]
  order_id char(26)
  invoice_number varchar(150)
  subtotal decimal(10,2)
  tax_amount decimal(10,2)
  total_amount decimal(10,2)
  currency varchar(10)
  status varchar(50)
  issued_at datetime
  created_at datetime
}

Table taxes {
  id char(26) [pk]
  name varchar(150)
  tax_type varchar(50)
  description text
  is_active boolean
  created_at datetime
  updated_at datetime
}

Table tax_rates {
  id char(26) [pk]
  tax_id char(26) [ref: > taxes.id]
  country varchar(100)
  state varchar(100)
  city varchar(100)
  rate decimal(5,2)
  is_compound boolean
  effective_from datetime
  created_at datetime
}

Table products {
  id char(26) [pk]
  name varchar(255)
  sku varchar(150)
  description text
  price decimal(10,2)
  stock_quantity int
  status varchar(50)
  created_at datetime
  updated_at datetime
}

Table flash_sales {
  id char(26) [pk]
  name varchar(255)
  description text
  start_at datetime
  end_at datetime
  status varchar(50)
  created_at datetime
  updated_at datetime
}

Table flash_sale_items {
  id char(26) [pk]
  flash_sale_id char(26) [ref: > flash_sales.id]
  product_id char(26) [ref: > products.id]
  original_price decimal(10,2)
  sale_price decimal(10,2)
  max_quantity int
  created_at datetime
  updated_at datetime
}
